DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Original Anatomic Site Uberon Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location within the body from which a specimen was originally obtained as captured in the Uberon name.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed._Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 12/27/23 Removed "Other" PV per Nov 2023 PCDC-U of Chicago/Mei Li review. This CDE is text component of Uberon terms.;  1/5/23 Created per CRDC DSS. mr

ReferenceDocuments.name: Coding Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description:
1. Go to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4
2. Use the search field to search for your term.
3. Copy the Uberon term from the top of the gray search results section.
